thread.title: The Troubling Signal That Semiconductor Stocks Are Sending
thread.title_full: The Troubling Signal That Semiconductor Stocks Are Sending

author: twocents@thestreet.com (Robert New)
title: The Troubling Signal That Semiconductor Stocks Are Sending
text:
The Troubling Signal That Semiconductor Stocks Are Sending By Robert New | 08/20/15 - 01:20 PM EDT Reprint 
NEW YORK ( TheStreet ) -- The stock market has been correcting some lately, but the S&P 500 is still holding in the key recent six-month range of 2040 to 2135. 
So let's take a technical look at some key sectors -- banks, semiconductors and transports -- to get a better sense of the broader market's health. 
The focus is a longer-term one, and all charts use a monthly time frame. 
First, let's take a look at the chart of the KBW Bank Index , which tracks the stocks of 24 major banking companies: 
Chart composed by www.TheInformedTrader.com and courtesy of Stockcharts.com 
Must Read: Warren Buffett's Top 10 Dividend Stocks 
The banks are under pressure this week. This is one group that's held up quite well overall until just recently. It's down about 3% for the month of August but still holding above the rising support line off the 2009 lows. A break of that key support line, however, would be a big-picture concern for the markets because of the banking sector's heavy weighting in the S&P 500. 1 of 3
